verses.esv: 15 Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him. 16 For all that is in the world—the desires of the flesh and the desires of the eyes and pride of life—is not from the Father but is from the world. 17 And the world is passing away along with its desires, but whoever does the will of God abides forever.
verses.kjv: 15 Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him. 16 For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world. 17 And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.
verses.niv: 15 Do not love the world or anything in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him. 16 For everything in the world--the cravings of sinful man, the lust of his eyes and the boasting of what he has and does--comes not from the Father but from the world. 17 The world and its desires pass away, but the man who does the will of God lives forever.

verses.esv: 2 Set your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on earth.
verses.kjv: 2 Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.niv: 2 Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things.

verses.esv: 4 You adulterous people! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Therefore whoever wishes to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
verses.kjv: 4 Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
verses.niv: 4 You adulterous people, don't you know that friendship with the world is hatred toward God? Anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

verses.esv: 2 Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
verses.kjv: 2 And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.
verses.niv: 2 Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is--his good, pleasing and perfect will.

verses.esv: 11 Take no part in the unfruitful works of darkness, but instead expose them.
verses.kjv: 11 And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
verses.niv: 11 Have nothing to do with the fruitless deeds of darkness, but rather expose them.

verses.esv: 11 For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation for all people, 12 training us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,
verses.kjv: 11 For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men, 12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
verses.niv: 11 For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men. 12 It teaches us to say "No" to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,

verses.esv: 14 The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to be silent.”
verses.kjv: 14 The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
verses.niv: 14 The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still."

verses.esv:
10   fear not, for I am with you;
    be not dismayed, for I am your God;
  I will strengthen you, I will help you,
    I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
verses.kjv: 10 Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
verses.niv: 10 So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.

verses.esv:
31   but they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength;
    they shall mount up with wings like eagles;
  they shall run and not be weary;
    they shall walk and not faint.
verses.kjv: 31 But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.niv: 31 but those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

verses.esv: 26 For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his soul? Or what shall a man give in return for his soul?
verses.kjv: 26 For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.niv: 26 What good will it be for a man if he gains the whole world, yet forfeits his soul? Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?

verses.esv: 12 training us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,
verses.kjv: 12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
verses.niv: 12 It teaches us to say "No" to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,

verses.esv:
4   Delight yourself in the LORD,
    and he will give you the desires of your heart.
verses.kjv: 4 Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
verses.niv: 4 Delight yourself in the LORD and he will give you the desires of your heart.

verses.esv: 19 Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit within you, whom you have from God? You are not your own, 20 for you were bought with a price. So glorify God in your body.
verses.kjv: 19 What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own? 20 For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.
verses.niv: 19 Do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; 20 you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your body.

verses.esv: 11 If then you have not been faithful in the unrighteous wealth, who will entrust to you the true riches?
verses.kjv: 11 If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.niv: 11 So if you have not been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv:
9   The heart is deceitful above all things,
    and desperately sick;
    who can understand it?
verses.kjv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?
verses.niv: 9 The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?

verses.esv: 15 Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him.
verses.kjv: 15 Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.
verses.niv: 15 Do not love the world or anything in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

verses.esv: 7 The end of all things is at hand; therefore be self-controlled and sober-minded for the sake of your prayers.
verses.kjv: 7 But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.
verses.niv: 7 The end of all things is near. Therefore be clear minded and self-controlled so that you can pray.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 18 as we look not to the things that are seen but to the things that are unseen. For the things that are seen are transient, but the things that are unseen are eternal.
verses.kjv: 18 While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal; but the things which are not seen are eternal.
verses.niv: 18 So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but on what is unseen. For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.

verses.esv: 30 Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
verses.kjv: 30 He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
verses.niv: 30 "He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me scatters.

verses.esv: 16 Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit dwells in you?
verses.kjv: 16 Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
verses.niv: 16 Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you?

verses.esv:
10   “I the LORD search the heart
    and test the mind,
  to give every man according to his ways,
    according to the fruit of his deeds.”
verses.kjv: 10 I the LORD search the heart, I try the reins, even to give every man according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings.
verses.niv: 10 "I the LORD search the heart and examine the mind, to reward a man according to his conduct, according to what his deeds deserve."

verses.esv:
20   Precious treasure and oil are in a wise man’s dwelling,
    but a foolish man devours it.
verses.kjv: 20 There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
verses.niv: 20 In the house of the wise are stores of choice food and oil, but a foolish man devours all he has.

verses.esv: 17 And the world is passing away along with its desires, but whoever does the will of God abides forever.
verses.kjv: 17 And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.
verses.niv: 17 The world and its desires pass away, but the man who does the will of God lives forever.
